name: Washington DC
fun_fact: Fun fact: DC's mysterious Mumbo Sauce (or Mambo Sauce) originated in African-American wing shops in the 1960s, and its exact origin is 'hotly contested' - but it's so beloved that go-go band Mambo Sauce named themselves after it and hit the Billboard charts!

hero_dishes.name: Half-Smoke
hero_dishes.description: Spiced beef-and-pork sausage with fiercely guarded secret spices, served in steamed bun
hero_dishes.origin_story: Popularized by Ben's Chili Bowl founders Ben and Virginia Ali over 50 years ago
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Ben's Chili Bowl on U Street, Nationals Stadium, H Street Corridor

hero_dishes.name: Mumbo Sauce Wings
hero_dishes.description: Fried chicken wings doused in sweet-spicy-tangy orange-red sauce
hero_dishes.origin_story: Likely originated at African-American wing shops in the 1960s, adopted by Chinese takeouts
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Yum's, Danny's, Jerry's, Eddie's, Andy's, Kenny's carryouts

hero_dishes.name: Chesapeake Blue Crab
hero_dishes.description: Steamed crabs seasoned with Old Bay spice blend
hero_dishes.origin_story: DC's proximity to Chesapeake Bay makes it a crab haven
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Waterfront restaurants, crab houses throughout the area

hero_dishes.name: Ethiopian Injera Platter
hero_dishes.description: Spongy flatbread with doro wat and misir wat stews
hero_dishes.origin_story: DC has the largest Ethiopian community outside Africa

signature_drinks.name: Gin Rickey
signature_drinks.description: Gin, lime juice, and soda water - DC's contribution to cocktail history
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: At classic DC bars, especially in Georgetown

signature_drinks.name: Mambo Sauce Bloody Mary
signature_drinks.description: Bloody Mary made with local mumbo sauce

food_culture_notes: DC is 'a southern melting pot' per local chefs
Henry's Soul CafÃ© (since 1968) is beloved for sweet potato pie
Horace and Dickies for two-piece fish on wheat bread
Go-go music and mumbo sauce are cultural symbols of Black DC
